TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: A moderator's account was compromised and used to place a "Hack" post, which was quickly moved to the Fault Vault. More info here.

Link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/132923-do-goto-tags-still-work/

 

Do the [goto] tags still work in some form, or is it no longer possible to link to specific lines in the text of a post?

14 minutes ago, Maximus97 said:

Link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/132923-do-goto-tags-still-work/

 

Do the [goto] tags still work in some form, or is it no longer possible to link to specific lines in the text of a post?

Nope, [goto] tags never worked in IPS to the best of my knowledge.

Why isn't my post count working? I have well over 740 posts, maybe over 750

Edited February 29, 2016 by Spaceception
Posts in the Lounge and in Games aren't counted to your total.

Has there ever been an idea to automatically lock posts once they read a certain period of time with no post activity or viewing activity? Or would such a thing even be possible to prevent old ideas spreading and confusing people?

3 hours ago, sal_vager said:

Posts in the Lounge and in Games aren't counted to your total.

Oh, all right

13 hours ago, Maximus97 said:

Has there ever been an idea to automatically lock posts once they read a certain period of time with no post activity or viewing activity? Or would such a thing even be possible to prevent old ideas spreading and confusing people?

It's been suggested (including by me back before I was a mod). While it seems like a good idea on the surface it kinda falls apart when you look more closely at it:

- People would bump their threads to keep them from being autolocked
- A thread being old doesn't mean it's no longer relevant
- Threads about mods, particularly, often still feature functional mods even if they haven't seen any action in a while

Basically, an occasional bad necro for the moderators to deal with is less bad than preventing all the valid necros and encouraging thread bumping.

I know this might be a nightmare, but is there a way to that the forum could be allowed to set up sub-threads within a thread? An example of this would be @ZooNamedGames Real Space Program, A sub-thread could be set up for each of the various missions instead of having one massively long thread with never-ending posts. The benefits would be that all related posts could be kept in each sub-thread, much the way many of us use sub-folders within our documents folders on our computers...

Just a thought.

1 hour ago, adsii1970 said:

I know this might be a nightmare, but is there a way to that the forum could be allowed to set up sub-threads within a thread?

 

Well, take a look at mission reports, including my own. People create links and have posts in their own thread that they update with information about different programs or missions they do. I imagine they can do it that way.

1 hour ago, adsii1970 said:

I know this might be a nightmare, but is there a way to that the forum could be allowed to set up sub-threads within a thread? An example of this would be @ZooNamedGames Real Space Program, A sub-thread could be set up for each of the various missions instead of having one massively long thread with never-ending posts. The benefits would be that all related posts could be kept in each sub-thread, much the way many of us use sub-folders within our documents folders on our computers...

Just a thought.

Not possible with the current software. I follow that thread, and I can see what you're talking about as there's a high volume of posting in it. Some possible solutions:

- Split off the chatter to an IRC channel or other medium rather than the forum thread
- Start a new thread for each mission in Mission Reports, keep the main thread for planning/coordinating

Not possible with the current software. I follow that thread, and I can see what you're talking about as there's a high volume of posting in it. Some possible solutions:

Is there a way we could add a title field for new posts on this forum software?

7 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

Is there a way we could add a title field for new posts on this forum software?

I don't believe so.
Well, shuckie-darn! That would have been the next best thing to sub-threads!
Hey, I have noticed that some announcments which we were allowed to post in are eventually closed.  Just curious, what is the policy on how long announcement threads stay open for?

11 minutes ago, Sampa said:

Hey, I have noticed that some announcments which we were allowed to post in are eventually closed.  Just curious, what is the policy on how long announcement threads stay open for?

There's not a set policy, it's more like we close them when/if the conversation becomes circular.
Ah!  ok!  May I ask for what defines a "circular" conversation?
When the conversation is going around and around in circles with nothing new being added.

4 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:

When the conversation is going around and around in circles with nothing new being added. 

hahaha, so in other words, when it becomes more of an unorganized staff meeting! 

Seriously, a question about the new forum +1 (rep thing, I think). Under the user profile, there is a link called "reputation activity" that when you click on it, there is nothing on the page. Am I missing something important or is this something that is in the works?
